page.title: 19PUBLIC HOUSES
page.content: {Bay Horse}Catforth was built in 1936 replacing an older building and is owned by the Lion Brewery. {Running Pump}Catforth.The name comes from the water pump and horse trough which still exists.A spring across the road providing the source of water.It is owned by Robinsons Brewery. {Derby Arms}Inskip was once owned by Lord Derby and now by Greenall Whitley The outbuildings were used in farming. {Eagle and Child}Wharles was once a farm. It was rethatched 2years ago. Previously owned by Lord Derby it is now a Boddingtons House known locally as Bird and Bastard. All the public houses serve bar snacks and meals and can be hired for private functions.Pool and darts games are played regularly.
